intro: Linzia glabra var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth linseed plant, is a herbaceous annual species native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with smooth, hairless stems and compound leaves that are pinnately divided. Its small white flowers appear in clusters, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in open fields. It is noted for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of linseed.
